attributes.title: Physical stock count.
attributes.description:
+ Physical stock verification was done on 06.03.25.

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -53.75loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +252 pieces

ü  All other materials had negligible variances.

The table below shows the summary of the stock findings
attributes.recommendation: The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.

value: ·           Strong internal controls will be maintained.
Control is ok and will maintain the trend

A stock take exercise was conducted on 06.03.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description:
+ Bread weight check was done on 06.03.25.

+ Findings were that over and underweight bread rate was beyond the allowed 10% of total pieces weighed.

·         Bread weights were sampled on 06/03/2025 and the following below were the results.
attributes.recommendation: + Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

value: + Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.
+ More controls on weight will be put to address the observed underweight loaves.
+ High underweight bread rate was highlighted in February 2025 audit report.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

+ ·         Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing.

·         Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence withholding revenue targets.

Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard bread weight as per KEBS specifications.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Bread damages (production and market) were analysed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25.

+ Production damage rate was higher than that allowed by 1,248loaves.

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation: + The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.

value: + We will put more efforts to address noted high production damages.
+ Noted high production damages will be addressed.
+ February audit report highlighted high production damage rate as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

·          Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ High production damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring control of bread damages to the allowed rate.

attributes.title: Mixing charts analysis (raw materials and finished products)
attributes.description:
+ Mixing charts figures were scrutinized for the month of February and March 2025 and these were compared to figures on cash flow and SAP system.

·          Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.02.25 – 06.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

Below are the summary of the findings

01.02.25 – 28.02.25

01.03.25 – 06.03.25

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.

value: + This is noted and will be maintained.
+ We will strengthen document accuracy to ensure that accurate information is conveyed on registers and SAP system.
+ February audit report highlighted that mixing charts/summaries figures matched SAP/cash flow figures posted.
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.02.25 – 06.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production records (mixing charts and summaries) information is accurately captured on SAP and Cash flow.

attributes.title: Physical cash verification
attributes.description:
·           Physical cash was verified on 06/03/2025, and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

·           Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.
attributes.recommendation: + Observed cash control is commendable.

value: + Proper cash control will be maintained.
+ This trend will be maintained.
+ Previous audit cash count on 03.02.25 showed minimal variation.
Previous
·           A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the company petty cash was well maintained.
+ Minimal cash variance suggests minimal cash loss risk and effective controls were put in place.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring effective cash  controls.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot checks.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 06.03.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the noted good stock and cash control.

value: + We shall maintain control at the mini shop.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+ Mini shop spot check on 03.02.25 showed that all bread at the mini shop was accounted for.
Previous
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Minishop SOPs are adhered to.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring mini shop SOP are strictly adhered to.

attributes.title: Bread yields analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Mixing charts summaries bread yields were analyzed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25.

+ Resulting yields matched those set on BOM.

The table below shows individual bread variety and respective yields.
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to set standard bread yields is commendable. This ensures revenue targets are realized.

value: + We always verify mixing chart and SAP figures to ensure standard yields are accurately reflected.
+ We will continue ensuring set yields are reflected on production summaries.
+ February 2025 audit report findings showed that set yields were realized. as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
+ Mixing charts and mixing chart summaries were analyzed to check if set standard yields were produced at the branch.
+ Realization of set standard bread yields ensures that revenue targets are realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard bread yields.

attributes.title: Customers outstanding balances.
attributes.description:
+ SAP debtors analysis as at 06.03.25 was analyzed.

+ Routes with outstanding balances were flagged.

·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs. 310,946.25.
attributes.recommendation: + Sales team must ensure credit limits for institutions are set and follow up.
attributes.effect: High outstanding balances exposes the company to losses through bad debts.

value: + We don’t supply customers with outstanding debts in that the SAP system is locked such that it doesn’t allow invoicing for such customers.

·         Will follow up with the sales rep and the TSM.

All customers with balances aren’t supplied until the debt is cleared
·         Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 6th March 2025 for routes was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ High route balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring no customer has outstanding debt.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Production bags and production staff were computed for the Month of February 2025.

+ Production efficiency at the branch was 4.58bags/staff against the set 4.5bags/staff.

PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Analysis was done from 01/02/2025 - 28/02/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
+  Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard packing efficiency is realized.

Surplus payments due to packing inefficiency should be surcharged.

value: + We will put in necessary measures to address packing inefficiency.
+ Noted Packing inefficiency will be addressed.
+ Packing inefficiency was highlighted on February 2025 audit report.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.

Packing efficiency was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.
+ Packing inefficiency increased production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensure compliance to set standard production efficiency.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Packing efficiency was analyzed for the month of February 2025. Expected loaves to be packed was computed alongside packers number hired over the same period.

+ Results showed that efficiency was 90.89crates/packer against set standard of 97crates/packer. Hence packing inefficiency and this cost the company Kshs. 33,744.00.

PACKING EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Packing efficiency (01/02/2025 – 28/02/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard packing efficiency is realized.

  •  Surplus payments due to packing inefficiency should be surcharged.

value: + We will put in necessary measures to address packing inefficiency.
+ Noted Packing inefficiency will be addressed.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted packing inefficiency as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.

Packing efficiency was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.
+ Packing inefficiency increased production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set standard packing efficiency.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption.
attributes.description:
+ Scrutiny of motor vehicle mileage register showed that each van has defined fuel consumption standard.

·           Motor vehicle fuel consumption standards is as follows;
attributes.recommendation: + Having set fuel consumption standards for sales vans is commendable.

value: + All vehicles have set fuel consumption standard.
+ We always ensure that each vehicle has set fuel consumption standard.
+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption standards was set for sales vans..
+ Having set fuel consumption standards ensures that fuel consumption is monitored for proper fuel management.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring sales vans have set fuel consumption standards.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Motor vehicle fuel consumption standard was determined for the month of February 2025.

+ Fuel consumption for all vans was within the allowed standards.

MOTOR VEHICLES FUEL CONSUMPTION (01.02.25 – 28.02.25)
attributes.recommendation: + Noted economical fuel consumption for most sales vans is commendable.

value: + Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
+ We will maintain the observed trend.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted economical fuel consumption for sales vans.
Previous

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans and generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring sales vans fuel consumption is within the set standards.
